statement: Grid Dynamics Holdings Inc. (GDYN) is set to join the S&P SmallCap 600 index effective January 2nd, replacing Revelyst Inc. (GEAR). This change is part of the annual index rebalancing process, where certain companies are added or removed based on criteria such as market capitalization and liquidity. Strategic Value Partners is acquiring Revelyst in a pending deal, which has contributed to the change.
introduction: Grid Dynamics Holdings Inc. will join the S&P SmallCap 600 on January 2, 2025, replacing Revelyst Inc.

statement: TScan Therapeutics, a clinical-stage biotechnology company, announced a $30 million registered direct offering with Lynx1 Capital Management LP and an investment fund advised by Lynx1. The proceeds from the sale of pre-funded warrants will be used to strengthen TScan's liquidity position and advance its development of T cell receptor-engineered T cell therapies for cancer treatment. This investment follows TScan's refinancing of its existing debt facility with Silicon Valley Bank and comes after the company filed a registration statement with the SEC in November 2022, which was declared effective in May 2023.
introduction: TScan Therapeutics announces a $30 million registered direct offering with Lynx1 Capital Management LP.

statement: Karyopharm Therapeutics Inc. (KPTI) has been experiencing a decline in its stock price, reaching a 52-week low of $0.59. The company has initiated a pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial to assess the efficacy and safety of its selinexor 60mg in patients with advanced or recurrent TP53 wild-type endometrial cancer. Despite some positive news, including the presentation of updated exploratory subgroup analyses from the SIENDO study, the stock has been impacted by market challenges. Insiders have sold more of their company stock than they have bought, and only 2.75% of the stock is held by insiders.
introduction: Karyopharm Therapeutics Inc. is experiencing a decline in its stock price, despite recent positive news, due to market challenges and insider selling.

statement: UnitedHealth Group Inc. and Amedisys Inc. have extended the deadline to complete their $3.3 billion merger to next year, following a lawsuit by the US Department of Justice and three states aiming to block the deal. The extension comes after the companies waived termination rights and agreed to a regulatory break fee of $275 million, which may increase to $325 million if specific conditions are not met. The merger, which was initially announced in 2022, has faced opposition from the government and states citing antitrust concerns, but the companies are pushing forward with the deal.
introduction: UnitedHealth Group and Amedisys have extended their $3.3 billion merger deadline to next year, after waiving termination rights and agreeing to a regulatory break fee, despite facing opposition from the US Department of Justice and three states over antitrust concerns.
